title.narrative: 5.3 HEALTH EMERGENCY EARTHQUAKE RESPONSE

description.narrative: Increased country capacity and delivery of services to prevent excess mortality among girls, boys and women in earthquake affected areas, which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By Dec 2017, early recovery and reconstruction efforts will enhance the national and local capacities to a quicker transition in achieving more sustainable outcomes for children and women in the 14 highly affected Earthquake districts with a focus on building resilience, strengthening systems, capacity building and increasing local and national ownership.

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

sector.narrative: Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased country capacity and delivery of services to prevent excess mortality among girls, boys and women in earthquakeaffected areas

description.narrative: Twenty two prefabricated health facilities were handed over to local government and 50 prefabricated construction sites are progressing in ten districts. The completed sites are fully furnished and equiped with basic MNCH equipments, health kits, delivery sets, water supply and toilets. Solar pannels to be added in 2018. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Children under 5 in the severely affected districts have access to life saving services for diarrhea

actual.value: 2015:Met. 406,181 children under five (145% of target) in the 14 severely affected districts ensured access to live-saving services for diarrhoea and cholera.

title.narrative: Mothers and new-borns in the severely affected districts reached with essential emergency care

actual.value: 2015:Met. 46,522 mothers and newborns (111% of target) in the severely affected districts were reached with essential and emergency care.

title.narrative: Children age 6-59 months in the severely affected districts vaccinated for measles

actual.value: 2015:Met. 537,081 children (106% of target) in the 14 severely affected districts were vaccinated through measles and polio immunization campaigns.

title.narrative: Number of functional health facilities under Prefabs

actual.value: 2017:22 prefabs handed over to the Government. Foundation of 50 sites completed and work ongoing at different levels in these prefabs. In total, all 74 prefab materials have been received.

title.narrative: Number of health facilities providing treatment for sick new-born as per national standard (level II and level III)

target.value: 2017:11 district hospitals have level II services; 5 tertiary hospitals have level III services

actual.value: 2017:36 CCE sites identified, orientation completed for district and VDC level and FCHV level orientation ongoing. Procurement of equipment in process. 36 CCE establishment is expected to be completed by 4th quarter of 2017 or 1st quarter in 2018.

title.narrative: Number of health facilities functioning as Comprehensive Center of Excellence (CCE) sites on MNCAH services

actual.value: 2017:36 CCE sites identified, orientation completed for district and VDC level and FCHV level orientation ongoing. Procurement of equipment in process. 36 CCE establishment is expected to be completed by 4th quarter of 2017 or 1st quarter in 2018.

title.narrative: Number of districts with disaster resilient cold chain system as per EVM standards
